content.prompt: Lines 11 and 12 ("The . . . silence") are best understood to mean which of the following?

choices.label: The silence is such that even the sea itself is aware of it.
We are in a quiet place, but the sea, however distant, is at least not silent.
Even the gentle murmuring of the sea is fading into silence.
The fact that we can just hear the far-off sea shows how quiet our surroundings are.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
